title: I'm Samuel 'Spookz' Broadley, Jungler for The Chiefs, AMA!
body:
Hey guys!

I'm a 21 year old Swinburne University student studying Media and Communication. I've been playing computer games religiously as far back as I can remember. I spent a majority of my time playing Wc3 and WoW before I moved on to League of Legends and I haven't stopped playing the game since. I was originally an ADC main where I climbed to about 2150 elo during season 2 on NA server, I then switched to the jungle role because of our mid laner Chief Swiffer who is basically a brother to me now. I was terrible at jungling for a while but I put in a hell of a lot of time learning the role and eventually got decent.

I've been on multiple teams including Team LoLa, Team Tesla, Mindfreak, Exile 5, Team Immunity and now The Chiefs. Under these teams I've competed in multiple online and lan events, my best memories and experiences were my two international trips to WCG China and Wild Cards in Turkey.

League of Legends has been a huge part of my life for the past few years, it has brought me lots of amazing things but a lot of anxiety and stress as well. I've invested A LOT of time into the game which has affected my life and relationships. Thankfully I have a super supportive family and the friends I've made in the League of Legends scene (especially my team) I basically consider my family.

Feel free to ask any questions and I will try my best to answer them all!

You can follow myself and my team on Twitter and Facebook -
[My Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/spookzLoL?fref=ts)
[Team Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/chiefsesc?fref=ts)
[@Chief_Spookz](https://twitter.com/Chief_Spookz)
[@ChiefsESC](https://twitter.com/ChiefsESC)

Furthermore what do you think is good and what can be improved on?

Really hope this made sense because I'd love an answer, I'm very curious to see what you come up with.

It obviously varies vastly from player to player, but I think typically a challenger/master player (grudges aside) are generally determined to win  from the start of the game they will predominantly use the forms of communication available to the best of their teams interest.
